intro: Lonchocarpus crassifolius, commonly known as the broad-leaf senna, is a shrub or small tree native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod fruits. The plant features palmate leaves with 5–7 leaflets, and its flowers are typically yellow or orange, attracting pollinators. It is known for its nitrogen-fixing ability, making it valuable in soil enrichment. However, some species in the genus are toxic, so caution is advised when handling or consuming any part of the plant.
